page.title: 07LAW AND ORDER.
page.content: We visited{Marsh Lane Police Station to find out how the{police}do their work.{Marsh Lane}is part of the {Merseyside Police,}it comes under "B" division and is responsible for the {Bootle}area. The{police}have a hard job because there is so much crime around. The biggest crime is theft. This is because houses and shops are often getting broken into, cars get stolen and there is a lot of shoplifting especially in the{New {Strand.}One of the main jobs a constable does is{"Walking the beat". This means the constable walks around the area keeping a look out for crime. If he sees something suspicious he can report it on his radio. The{policemen sometimes direct traffic or help us to cross the road.{The policemen are {here to help us. (Kevin Roach)
